Art. 4.124. 
Objection to repossession.
 Each of the co-heirs may object to the right of repossession in respect of the undeveloped property concerned, which is located in residential areas as defined by the legislation on town and country planning.
 The objection applies only to building plots that do not include buildings used for farming. This objection does not apply to the other properties involved in the takeover.
